items.summary: A multi-billion-dollar gold project owned by the world’s biggest bullion producer has been invaded by illegal diggers in northern Peru, according to a top government official.

items.title: Oracle-Broadcom one-two punch hits AI trade, but investor optimism persists
items.summary: USA-STOCKS/AI (UPDATE 1, ANALYSIS):ANALYSIS-Oracle-Broadcom one-two punch hits AI trade, but investor optimism persists

items.title: Tesla US sales drop to nearly 4-year low in November despite launch of cheaper versions
items.summary: Making a success of the more affordable variants, called Standard, is important for Tesla and a test of its strategy for how to keep selling cars and bring in revenue as it transitions to making robotaxis and building humanoid robots, which are the core reasons investors value the company at $1.4 trillion. EV sales have taken a hit broadly since the end of September when the Trump administration ended $7,500 federal tax credits. To combat the fall in demand, Tesla in October launched stripped-down versions of its Model Y SUV and Model 3 compact sedan, priced about $5,000 below the previous bas

items.title: Delhi HC refuses to stay order allowing Dr Reddy's to export semaglutide
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has taken a firm stand by rejecting Novo Nordisk's plea to pause a prior ruling. This decision empowers Dr Reddy's Laboratories to manufacture and ship its Semaglutide drug to countries free from Novo Nordisk's patent. The court described Novo Nordisk's arguments as lacking strength, with the next hearing scheduled for January 15.

items.title: Himachal drug cos under stop orders found operational
items.summary: Himachal Pradesh's drug regulation bodies came across a concerning trend: numerous pharmaceutical companies were found to be operating illicitly, despite official directives to cease manufacturing after failing quality evaluations. Inspections indicated these firms may not have stopped production as mandated.

items.title: CCEA clears 100% FDI in insurance
items.summary: The government has approved a new bill allowing 100 percent foreign investment in the insurance sector. This move aims to boost growth and improve insurance coverage across India. Companies must invest all premiums within the country. The bill also permits a single entity to offer life, general, and health insurance.

items.title: IndiGo parent moves HC against double customs duty on reimported parts
items.summary: InterGlobe Aviation, the parent of IndiGo, has approached the Delhi High Court. The company is seeking a refund of ₹900 crore paid as customs duty. This duty was levied on aircraft engines and parts reimported after repairs abroad. InterGlobe argues this is an unconstitutional double levy. The court will hear the case on December 19.

items.title: Europe’s Stoxx 600 Surpasses November Closing Record; UBS Jumps
items.summary: Europe’s benchmark index rose above its November closing record, tracking a global rally fueled by the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cut and its upbeat assessment of the US economy.

items.title: European Stocks Retreat as US Tech Selloff Thwarts Fresh Record
items.summary: Europe’s benchmark index dropped on Friday, retreating from the edge of a record high as a selloff in US technology stocks weighed on global gauges.

items.title: Private companies may be kept out of Uranium mining
items.summary: New amendments to India's atomic energy bill may reserve uranium mining exclusively for government companies. Private firms might be excluded from this critical sector. The proposed changes to the Atomic Energy Act, 1962, and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damages Act, 2010, are expected soon. This move comes despite earlier considerations to allow private participation in local uranium production.

items.title: Civil Aviation Minister Naidu defends airfare deregulation
items.summary: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu stated the Centre can cap airfares in emergencies. However, he clarified fare caps are not a permanent fix for rising ticket prices. The government has imposed limits based on flight duration following IndiGo's mass flight cancellations.

items.title: Tata Steel to boost capacity by 50% to maintain market lead
items.summary: Tata Steel plans a nearly 50% capacity expansion in India to defend market share and secure raw materials, with most capex expected from internal accruals. This strategic move aims to align new capacities with anticipated demand growth post-FY29, ensuring profitability and maintaining a healthy balance sheet.

items.title: Tata Steel to boost capacity by 50% to maintain market lead
items.summary: Tata Steel plans a nearly 50% capacity expansion in India to defend market share and secure raw materials, with most capex expected from internal accruals. This strategic move aims to align new capacities with anticipated demand growth post-FY29, ensuring profitability and maintaining a healthy balance sheet.

items.title: Nov retail inflation rises a tad to 0.7%
items.summary: Retail inflation saw a slight increase to 0.71% in November, up from October's 0.25%. This rise occurred as food deflation lessened. Price pressures remained subdued due to tax cuts and softer food prices. Inflation stayed below the central bank's target range for the fourth month. Food prices declined for the sixth consecutive month.

items.title: Hot Wheels! Motown stays in fast lane as November show wholesale dispatches rise in double-digits
items.summary: Vehicle sales saw a significant jump in November. Car, two-wheeler and three-wheeler wholesale dispatches to dealers increased strongly year-on-year. This surge followed the festive season, indicating continued consumer demand. Manufacturers are building stocks to meet demand during the upcoming marriage season.

items.title: Shiprocket files UDRHP for Rs 2,342-crore IPO
items.summary: Shiprocket, a Gurugram-based D2C shipment and checkout service provider, has filed an updated draft red herring prospectus for a Rs 2,342-crore IPO. The company aims to raise Rs 1,100 crore in fresh capital, with existing investors and founders also selling shares.

items.title: India, France near deal on tax treaty, to lower levy on dividends paid to French parent companies
items.summary: India and France are nearing a revised tax treaty that will reduce dividend taxes for French parent companies holding over 10% stakes to 5%, while increasing it to 15% for minority shareholders. The agreement also proposes allowing India to tax share sales by any French entity, shifting to a source-based capital gains framework.

items.title: Silver slides below Rs 2 lakh/kg mark after scaling all-time peak
items.summary: Silver made a dramatic U-turn after scaling a record high in Friday's volatile session. On MCX, the March 5 futures contract ended at Rs 1,92,615, down by Rs 236, or 0.1 per cent, from its previous close.

items.title: Coal acquired via auction open to any use
items.summary: The Centre has amended its Coal (Non-Regulated Sector) Linkage Policy of 2016, enabling the export of coal from blocks with existing linkages. A new policy, CoalSETU, will allow end-use free purchase of coal for any industrial use and export, excluding traders. Coking coal will not be offered due to domestic scarcity.

items.title: Adani Green Energy case: SEBI clears insider trading charges against Pranav Adani, his relatives
items.summary: The case centred on whether Pranav Adani had disclosed confidential details about Adani Green Energy's planned acquisition of SB Energy before the information became public.

items.title: India second-biggest Russian fossil fuel buyer after China
items.summary: India significantly increased its purchase of Russian fossil fuels in November. This surge placed India as the second-largest importer, following China. The rise was fueled by higher imports of crude oil, coal, and refined oil products. This comes as the United States continues to pressure India to reduce these purchases.

items.title: Railways working on cost-cut plan ahead of higher wage bill
items.summary: Indian Railways is preparing for increased wage expenses from the Eighth Pay Commission. The national transporter is focusing on cost reductions in maintenance, procurement, and energy. These measures aim to strengthen finances and improve operating performance. Anticipated savings from electrification and higher freight earnings will support the additional fund requirement.

items.title: Sebi dismisses insider trading charges against Pranav Adani, others in AGEL case
items.summary: The assumptions in the show-cause notices were inconsistent with evidence, Sebi said, ending an investigation that lasted almost three years.

items.title: Telecom operators ask govt to rationalise spectrum valuation
items.summary: Telecom operators are calling for lower spectrum prices and better payment terms. They want reserve prices cut to 50% of valuation to boost auction participation. Operators also requested longer spectrum assignment periods and a longer moratorium on payments. They believe restricting spectrum supply creates artificial scarcity.

items.title: Silver Price Today: After touching Rs 2 lakh, MCX silver slips Rs 8,000 on profit-booking; gold also trims gains
items.summary: Intraday frenzy sends silver past historic Rs 2 lakh mark, but profit-booking sparks sharp late-night selloff; gold eases after hitting new peak.

items.summary: The Additional Commissioner of CGST, Delhi South Commissionerate, has imposed the penalty of ₹58,74,99,439 on the airline for the financial year 2020-21

items.summary: The agreement, valid until March 2026 and extendable by mutual consent, enhances volume visibility and strengthens A-1’s position in speciality chemicals.

items.title: Adani Energy Solutions acquires KPS III HVDC Transmission Ltd
items.summary: Adani Energy Solutions Ltd has acquired KPS III HVDC Transmission Ltd. This move strengthens AESL's strategy for shareholder value. The project will help evacuate 2.5 GW of renewable energy. This is part of the Khavda renewable energy park's expansion. The acquisition was completed on December 12, 2025. The deal was done at face value.

items.summary: Institutional Investor Advisory Services India has criticized IndiGo's promoter Rahul Bhatia for his perceived lack of executive leadership during the airline's recent operational crisis, which saw over 4,500 flight cancellations in the first week of December.

items.title: SBI cuts deposit and lending rates after RBI repo rate reduction
items.summary: The bank has reduced the interest rate on its 2–3-year term deposits by 5 basis points to 6.40 per cent, while its special 444-day Amrit Vrishti deposit scheme now carries 6.45 per cent, down 15 bps.

items.title: SBI passes RBI rate cut benefit to borrowers, reduces lending rate by 25 bps
items.summary: State Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank have reduced lending rates by 25 basis points, mirroring the RBI's policy rate cut. This move makes loans cheaper for existing and new borrowers, impacting EMIs for retail, MSME, and corporate clients. MCLR and Base Rate have also been lowered.

items.summary: Novo Nordisk has launched Ozempic in India at a competitive price, aiming to capture a significant share of the growing weight-loss market. Leveraging its established dominance in diabetes care and insulin leadership, the company seeks to accelerate adoption of its GLP-1 therapy, positioning it against rivals like Eli Lilly.

items.title: Stock market holidays 2026: NSE releases full list, stock market to remain shut for 15 days — check details
items.summary: Stock market holidays 2026: The NSE announced its market holidays for 2026, with the stock market closed for 15 days. Key holidays include Republic Day, Holi, Diwali, and Christmas. March has the most holidays, totaling three, while weekends are also non-trading days.

IRCTC begins branded meal service trials on select Vande Bharat, Amrit Bharat trains
items.summary: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) is conducting trials to improve on-board catering by de-linking meal production and service. This initiative aims to partner with branded food players to offer fresh, hygienic, and diverse meal options on select Vande Bharat and Amrit Bharat trains. Passenger feedback from these trials will guide future enhancements to railway dining services.

items.title: Usha Martin block deal: Promoter entity sells stake worth Rs 99 crore. Morgan Stanley among buyers
items.summary: Usha Martin's promoter, Peterhouse Investments India Limited, divested 23 lakh shares for Rs 99 crore in a block deal. Morgan Stanley and Bandhan Mutual Fund were among the buyers, acquiring shares at Rs 430 each. The transaction occurred as Usha Martin's stock closed higher at Rs 440.45.

items.title: NCLAT asks IL&FS to not create third-party rights over headquarters property
items.summary: The NCLAT has directed IL&FS not to create any third-party interest over its Mumbai headquarters. This comes after Brookfield's appeal against a recent NCLT order. The NCLAT also asked Brookfield to renew its performance guarantee within a month. IL&FS must file its reply by January 6, and Brookfield its rejoinder by January 16.

items.title: India urges China to resolve issues relating to export control
items.summary: A range of issues relating to bilateral ties were discussed during two-day visit to Beijing of Sujit Ghosh, the joint secretary in the East Asia division at the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

items.title: Another Mumbai bungalow to make way for redevelopment with Rs 164-cr deal
items.summary: A vintage bungalow in Santacruz west has been sold for Rs 164 crore. This prime property will be redeveloped into luxury apartments.  Such deals are common in the Bandra-Khar-Santacruz belt.  Developers are acquiring these plots for premium residential projects.  Demand for luxury homes remains strong.  This sale highlights the ongoing transformation of standalone homes into new housing stock.

items.summary: With domestic airfares hitting record highs, Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu has hinted at government intervention, including potential fare caps. The ministry has warned airlines against abnormal pricing as last-minute fares spiral.

items.title: IndiGo faces nearly Rs 59 cr penalty in relation to GST; airline to contest order
items.summary: IndiGo faces a significant penalty of nearly Rs 59 crore related to GST. The airline has been issued a demand notice along with a penalty for the financial year 2020-21. IndiGo believes the order is erroneous and plans to contest it. The company has received advice from external tax advisors.

items.title: Nasdaq submits new plan with more power to block IPOs vulnerable to manipulation
items.summary: Nasdaq filed a new rule on Friday that would allow the exchange to block IPOs even when companies meet all listing standards if it detects red flags that could make a company's stock vulnerable to manipulation.

items.summary: As of 11:45 A.M. Eastern Time, the S&amp;P 500 fell 1.3%, the Nasdaq Composite shed 1.9%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 0.6%.

items.summary: IndiGo said it is set to operate more than 2,000 flights Friday as it continued to make progress towards normalising its operations.

US yields rise after Fed comments as economic outlook gauged
items.summary: U.S. 10-year Treasury yields rose on Friday after two straight sessions of declines, as investors assessed commentary from a flurry of Fed speakers and a positive outlook on the economy.

items.title: IRFC aims to cross loan sanction of Rs 60,000 crore in Q3
items.summary: Outlining long-term strategic vision for the Navratna CPSE at its 40th Foundation Day, Dubey said this milestone signals the organisation's strong fundamentals, disciplined financial architecture and renewed strategic focus, setting the tone for the next phase of the company's growth story.

items.title: RBI Deputy Governor rules out stablecoins in India
items.summary: “Cryptocurrency is not money as they do not have any underlying cash flows,” says Deputy Governor T. Rabi Sankar

items.title: Insurance Amendment Bill: Cabinet clears 100% FDI in Indian insurers — Key reforms explained
items.summary: The Union Cabinet has approved the Insurance Amendment Bill, proposing 100% FDI in Indian insurers, allowing foreign companies full ownership subject to key leadership roles being held by Indian citizens. The Bill also enables mergers with non-insurance entities and introduces a dedicated policyholder fund. However, proposals for a composite unified licence, open-architecture agents and reduced net-worth norms for small insurers have been excluded.

items.title: 5G reaches 99.9% of India’s districts; Centre details rollout progress in Parliament
items.summary: India has rolled out 5G services across every State and UT, covering 99.9% of districts. Over 5.08 lakh 5G BTS have been deployed, supported by government schemes such as BharatNet, 4G Saturation and LWE-area connectivity. Faster Right of Way clearances through the GatiShakti Sanchar portal and widespread infrastructure sharing have accelerated deployment. Nationwide, total BTS installations across all technologies have crossed 31 lakh.

items.title: Cannabis stocks surge on report Trump seeks to ease restrictions
items.summary: Shares of cannabis companies jumped on Friday after the Washington Post reported U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to push the government to dramatically loosen federal restrictions on marijuana.

items.title: Adani Green insider trading: Sebi ends case against Pranav Adani without any direction or penalty
items.summary: Sebi has dropped insider trading charges against Pranav Adani and two others, ruling their Adani Green trades occurred after news of the SB Energy acquisition became public, making the information no longer price sensitive.

items.summary: The ICC and JioStar have jointly refuted reports suggesting JioStar's withdrawal from their India media-rights agreement. Both organizations affirmed the contract remains valid and in full force, with JioStar committed to its obligations for upcoming ICC events. This statement counters claims of financial losses and a new bidding process for future rights.

items.title: LIC trimmed Adani Ports stake by 2% between 2022 and 2025. Check details
items.summary: LIC has reduced its stake in Adani Ports to 7.34% by selling nearly 3.9 crore shares since 2022, even as the stock outperforms benchmarks and posts strong quarterly revenue and profit growth.

items.summary: IndiGo has filed a petition in the Delhi High Court seeking a refund of over ₹900 crore in customs duty paid on aircraft engines and parts re-imported after overseas repairs. The airline argues the duty is unconstitutional and constitutes a double levy. The case was adjourned as one judge recused herself due to her son's employment with IndiGo.

items.title: JioStar, ICC jointly refute reports of media rights disagreement in India; ‘existing agreement remains fully in force’
items.summary: JioStar and the International Cricket Council have jointly denied reports of the Reliance Industries-controlled broadcaster seeking an exit from the media rights deal.

items.summary: Gold prices reached a historic high of  ₹1,35,199 per 10 grams on December 12, driven by a declining US Dollar index. Silver also surged, crossing  ₹2 lakh per kilogram. The Fed's recent rate cuts have raised concerns about dollar debasement, boosting demand for precious metals.

items.title: What happens when families put phones away at dinner? Here’s what survey reveals
items.summary: The survey uncovers an emotional pattern many families will recognise. Parents, distracted by work or habit, tend to micro-check their phones—sending subtle signals of unavailability. Children, in turn, interpret these silent breaks as lost warmth.

items.title: Govt has powers to cap airfares but it is not single-way solution: Aviation Minister Naidu
items.summary: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu stated the government has powers to cap airfares in extraordinary circumstances but it's not a sole solution. He highlighted discussions to manufacture aircraft in India to address non-availability and supply chain issues, while emphasizing deregulation's role in sector growth.

items.summary: Instead of stablecoins, Sankar advocated for Central Bank Digital Currencies as the superior alternative.

items.summary: In a written reply to a question in the Rajya Sabha, the minister said that a GPS-based Fog Safety Device (FSD) is provided to loco pilots in fog-affected areas, which enables loco pilots to know the distance of the approaching landmarks like signals, level crossing gates, etc., which helps to prevent accidents.

items.summary: The move also comes a day after Oman’s Shura Council approved the Gulf nation’s proposed FTA with India, signalling strong political will on both sides. Bilateral trade remains upbeat—reaching US$ 8.94 billion in FY 2023–24 and rising to US$ 10.61 billion in FY 2024–25, according to an official statement.

items.title: Credit demand climbs to 11.5% as deposits lag, RBI data shows
items.summary: Credit demand is increasing across India. Banks are lending more to retail and service sectors. Industrial credit is also firming up. Deposit growth is steady but slower than last year. This trend is expected to continue with a repo rate reduction. Higher disposable income and GST rationalisation are also boosting demand. Rural demand remains robust, and urban demand is recovering.

items.summary: The rupee closed at a record low of 90.41 amid strong importer dollar demand, Mexico’s tariff move, lack of the India-US trade deal, and continued FPI outflows, marking a 1% December drop and nearly 6% yearly depreciation.

This vital tool for accessing life-saving technologies during emergencies is fully preserved. The agreement also grants Indian companies guaranteed access to the UK's public procurement market, valued at over 90 billion pounds annually. Negotiations for FTAs with the European Union and the US are also ongoing.

NCRTC is enhancing connectivity and reducing train frequency to meet demand.

items.summary: Haier India has introduced its new Gravity AI Series air conditioners. These premium units feature AI-driven climate personalisation and predictive cooling. items.summary: IndiGo plans to fly over 2,000 flights on December 12, 2025. Operations are stabilizing with flights steadily increasing. All 138 destinations are connected. items.summary: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has commenced civil work on the Lajpat Nagar-Saket G Block corridor of Phase IV, marking the first construction beyond priority stretches. This move aims to provide better returns to coconut growers and boost production. NAFED and NCCF will continue as nodal agencies for procurement.

items.summary: Reserve Bank of India Deputy Governor T. Rabi Sankar cautioned against stablecoins, citing significant macroeconomic risks and their lack of unique utility compared to fiat money. He emphasized that these digital tokens do not offer benefits beyond what traditional currency can provide, and India will maintain a cautious approach to such innovations.

items.summary: India's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) program has significantly boosted manufacturing, investment, and exports, with nearly ₹2 lakh crore invested across 14 sectors. This has led to over ₹18.7 lakh crore in production and sales, creating 12.6 lakh jobs. Key sectors like pharmaceuticals and electronics have seen substantial growth, enhancing domestic capacity and global competitiveness.

items.summary: IndiGo cancelled approximately 160 flights from Delhi and Bengaluru on Friday, following over 200 cancellations the previous day. The airline's top executives appeared before a DGCA probe panel investigating the widespread operational disruptions. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation also sacked four Flight Operations Inspectors due to the ongoing issues.

items.summary: Infrastructure development has greatly benefited India's tourism sector. Travel times have reduced significantly due to improvements in railways, roadways, waterways, and aviation. This has led to a surge in visitor numbers at spiritual and other destinations. Hospitality chains are expanding rapidly. The government aims to increase tourism's contribution to GDP to 10% by 2047.

The government has initiated a robust campaign to clear these encroachments. As the land is recovered, it will serve dual purposes: advancing critical railway infrastructure and enabling commercial development on areas that aren’t urgently required.

items.title: Why are all eyes now watching your shopping cart?
items.summary: India's economic growth is increasingly driven by robust domestic consumption, a crucial buffer against global trade headwinds and rising tariffs. Low inflation, coupled with GST cuts and easing income taxes, is boosting household purchasing power. A significant revival in rural demand further strengthens this internal economic resilience, positioning consumer spending as India's most reliable growth pillar amidst global uncertainties.

items.summary: State-run insurance stocks rallied after the Union Cabinet approved 100% FDI in the insurance sector, triggering strong market optimism. New India Assurance led the gains, followed by GIC, LIC, and private insurers such as ICICI Prudential and SBI Life. The reform aims to attract foreign capital, streamline licensing, and introduce composite licences, forming a key part of the government's “Insurance for All by 2047” vision.

items.title: Market Wrap:  Sensex adds 450 pts, Nifty above 26,000 in Fed-driven market bounce
items.summary: Indian equities rose on Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty extending their Fed-driven rebound even as both ended the week lower. Metals and realty led gains, midcaps outperformed, and global sentiment improved after the U.S. rate cut. However, a weaker rupee, FII outflows, and tech-sector jitters capped enthusiasm.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 extend gains to 2nd consecutive session— 10 key highlights

items.summary: The Indian stock market remained strong on December 12, with the Nifty 50 closing at 26,022 and the Sensex at 85,206. Metal stocks surged due to a weak US dollar, while the rupee hit a record low against the dollar.

items.title: Renewable energy capacity addition surges in April-November

items.title: Mexico's tariffs to hit India's auto, auto components, metal, electronics exports: Experts

Under the decision, Mexico will impose steep import tariffs - ranging from about 5 per cent to as high as 50 per cent on a wide range of goods from countries that do not have free trade agreements with Mexico, including India, China, South Korea, Thailand and Indonesia.

items.title: Park Medi World, Nephrocare IPOs see strong last-day demand

items.summary: The PMFME scheme is boosting small businesses.  Entrepreneurs, farmers, and women are seeing their income rise significantly.  The scheme has already increased turnovers by 1.7 times.
